etymologies: late 16th century: from medieval Latin ultramarinus ‘beyond the sea’; the name of the pigment is from obsolete Italian (azzurro) oltramarino, literally ‘(azure) from overseas’

definitions: a brilliant deep blue pigment originally obtained from lapis lazuli
shortDefinitions: brilliant deep blue pigment originally obtained from lapis lazuli

definitions: an imitation of ultramarine, made from powdered fired clay, sodium carbonate, sulfur, and resin.
shortDefinitions: imitation of such pigment, made from powdered fired clay

examples.text: the color of the water deepened to ultramarine
